releases.details: Originally released in a double-pack with 'Arc of Infinity'.
special_features: Commentary by Peter Davison, Janet Fielding, Sarah Sutton, Eric Saward
Behind-the-scenes action from the studio recording sessions

notes: This story was filmed primarily at Heathrow Airport and marks the first Doctor Who production to shoot on a Concorde aircraft.
Anthony Ainley is credited as 'Leon Ny Taiy' in part one to disguise the identity of the Master.
Working titles included 'Zanadin', 'Xeraphin', and 'Flight into Time'.

in_universe_mythology: The Xeraphin, an ancient race believed to have been destroyed during the Vardon-Kosnax War.
real_world_cultural_references: Cricket, specifically mentioning the Great Exhibition of 1851.

continuity_notes: The story follows directly after 'Earthshock', with Nyssa and Tegan dealing with Adric's death.
Tegan's final appearance in this story until she returns in 'Arc of Infinity'.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor, Nyssa, and Tegan investigate a missing Concorde at Heathrow Airport, which leads them back 140 million years into the past where they encounter the Master disguised as Kalid, who is attempting to control the ancient powers of the Xeraphin.
Part One sees the team face their grief over Adric's death while trying to uncover the mystery of the missing flight, finding themselves at Heathrow amidst the illusions cast upon them.
In Part Two, Nyssa becomes attuned to the psychokinetic energies controlled by Kalid, while the Doctor attempts to navigate the Citadel and free the captured Concorde passengers.
Part Three reveals the true identity of Kalid as the Master, who is seeking a new power source. The heroes must confront their own past and the powers manipulating their reality.
The conclusion in Part Four sees the Doctor thwart the Master's plans, returning the passengers to Heathrow while Tegan decides to part ways with the Doctor and Nyssa, leaving them in the TARDIS.
